timeline.headline: Welcome to Raaj CanCode
timeline.text: Hi, I'm Raaj, a student studying Computer Engineering in the Natioanl University of Singapore, who is currently interning in the Silicon Valley. This site is a list of my projects past and present.

date.headline: Joined NUS
date.text: Joined NUS Computer Engineering to begin my computer science and electrical engineering journey!

date.headline: C++ Cashier System
date.text:
Was my first major programming project. A full fledged cashier system written purely in C++.

Link

date.headline: NUS Navigator
date.text:
App that was built for my campus that provided Shuttle Bus Routing and navigation. Won 4th place in NUS iCreate Mobile App Development competition.

Link

date.headline: UROP Tele-Rehabilitation
date.text:
Worked in the Undergraduate Research Opportunities Programme to develop a full fledged product for muscle movements and rehabilitation.

Link

date.headline: ToDo++
date.text:
ToDo application written in C# for a software engineering module. Accepts natural language as an input and was voted one of the best apps in terms of UX and UI

Link

date.headline: iOS controlled Robot
date.text:
An iOS application that interacts via WiFi to move and control a small robot

Link

date.headline: x86 based lift controller
date.text:
An Intel 8088 based lift controller built in Assembly for CG2007

Link

date.headline: RoomTraq
date.text:
Built for a hackathon organized by NUS hackers and Palantir. This hack counts the number of people in a room and can be viewed on an iOS App. Won 3rd Place.

Link

date.headline: Mixtron 3000
date.text:
A mixer/transmitter audio circuit built with op-amps for EE2031

Link

date.headline: Mains control
date.text:
So i got sick of controlling the fan and AC in my room, and i built an iOS controlled power box. Home automation indeed.

Link

date.headline: Booking App Prototype
date.text:
Interned a startup called Daniel Wireless which specialized in mobile app development. Helped to build one of their flagship products which was a Booking Application that could be extended onto any system

Link

date.headline: WiRED
date.text:
A full fledged home automation solution that records IR signal and saves them to the cloud. The device can then fire these IR signals out and can be controlled with an app. It can also be configured wirelessly.

Link

date.headline: Start internship at Lark
date.text:
Start my internship in the Silicon Valley at Lark Technologies

Link

date.headline: STM32F4
date.text:
So I started messing around with the STM32F4 board. We use this MCU in our product here.

Link

date.headline: Preamble
date.text:
Took part in the Launch Hackathon with a couple of people and this was our creation. Essentially a Business Card for the Web. Was involved in backend side code in this 48 hour hackathon.

Link

date.headline: Python FFT Visualizer
date.text:
A simple FFT Visualizer I wrote in python with matplotlib and scipy. Feed in a bunch of dates and get a time and fft plot.

Link

date.headline: CBR Circuit
date.text:
Circuit that I designed. Charges a Lithium Ion battery, and outputs both 5 and 3.3 volts

Link

date.headline: Qeo Home Challenge
date.text:
A one month long hackathon where you have to integrate the Qeo API with a potential use case. Using Raspberry Pi's and a bunch of IR sensors, we built a room detection system and demonstrated it's business model and use case.

Link
